event.title: located in the U.S. state of Illinois with a population of 60,218 at the 2010

data.event: Jackson County is a county located in the U.S. state of Illinois with a population of 60,218 at the 2010 census.
The county was incorporated on January 10, 1816 and named for Andrew Jackson.
Human occupation of Jackson County began about 11,500 years ago.

event.title: 1813, Conrad Will, namesake of Will County, conducted

data.event: As early as 1813, Conrad Will, namesake of Will County, conducted a large salt extraction operation using slave labor on the banks of the Big Muddy River, south of today's Murphysboro.
